Patrimony.origin: [Middle French patrimonie , from Latin patrimonium , from patr- pater father]

1.definition: an estate inherited from one's father or ancestor [to deprive her and her coheirs of their ", 260 Cal. App. 2d 120 (1968)"]

2.definition: an estate or endowment belonging to a church [the property of a dissolved parish shall pass to the of the diocese]

3.definition: the net assets of a personthe sum of a person's assets and liabilities [reimbursement shall be made from the of the spouse who owes reimbursement ""]
